title: Pakistan expects Sri Lanka to remain neutral in case of war with India
byline: Against the backdrop of escalation of tension with India following the Pahalgam incident and warning that the 1960 Indus Waters Treaty (IWT) will be suspended, Pakistan expects Sri Lanka to play a neutral, non-aligned role which is the trademark of its foreign policy, a top diplomatic source on the situation said yesterday on condition of anonymity.

title: Sri Lanka, Pakistan hold defence talks in Islamabad
byline: Defence Secretary Air Vice Marshal Sampath Thuyacontha (Retd), currently in Pakistan for the 5th annual Sri Lanka-Pakistan Bilateral Defence Dialogue, met with Pakistan’s Defence Minister Khawaja Muhammad Asif yesterday.

title: Pakistan minister warns of possible Indian military strike in 24-36 hours
byline: Pakistan’s minister for information and broadcasting says Islamabad has “credible intelligence” that India intends to launch a military strike within the next 24 to 36 hours, as tensions between the two countries escalate following a deadly attack in Indian-administered Kashmir.

title: SL recovery no “understatement”, says CB Governor
byline: Sri Lanka may still be on the road to recovery, but its steps in correcting long-standing policy failures are now being recognised where it matters most—by key international lenders.

title: WhatsApp to stop working on select iPhones from May 2025
byline: WhatsApp users with older iPhones will soon lose access to the messaging platform, as the company plans to withdraw support for devices running outdated iOS versions starting May 5, 2025.

title: Fire tears through hotel in Kolkata, killing at least 14 people
byline: A fire tore through a hotel in the city of Kolkata in eastern India, killing at least 14 people, police said Wednesday.

title: Six die, more than 17,000 infected due to dengue
byline: Sri Lanka has reported more than 17,000 dengue cases during the first four months of the year, highlighting a significant public health concern, Health Promotion Bureau.

title: DMT head office closed May 5, 6 for LG polls
byline: The head office of the Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) will be closed on Monday (5) and Tuesday (6) to facilitate the local government elections scheduled to be held May 6.

title: 11 million TINs registered, most yet to be issued: IRD
byline: The number of Taxpayer Identification Number (TIN) registrations at the Inland Revenue Department (IRD) has reached 11 million, but most of the TINs have not been issued to the respective individuals.

title: Five arrested in alleged gang rape of woman in Welipenna
byline: The Welipenna Police have arrested five suspects in connection with the alleged abduction and gang rape of a 45-year-old woman inside a three-wheeler and a house.

title: EU willing to continue supporting Sri Lanka
byline: The Head of South Asia Division, European External Action Service of the European Union, Charles Whiteley stated that the European Union has a favorable perspective on the current GSP+ review process.

title: No price revision for LAUGFS gas in May
byline: There will be no price revision for LAUGFS Gas domestic cylinder refills in May, LAUGFS Gas Director and Cluster CEO Dr. Niroshan J. Pieries said.

title: Countrywide liquor sales banned for May Day
byline: Countrywide liquor sales, except for the occupants of three star hotels and above, will be prohibited tomorrow in line with the May Day, by order of the Excise Department.

title: Tamil diaspora responds positively to President’s investment call
byline: Following President Anura Kumara Dissanayake’s request for Tamil people in the diaspora to invest in Sri Lanka to help the country recover from the economic crisis, Mawbima Janatha Party (MJP) Leader and Tamil Diaspora General Secretary Nimalan Vishwanathan said the diaspora is ready to invest in the country.

title: Jailor arrested over Ganemulla Sanjeewa murder released on bail
byline: Jailor Manoj Udayakantha, who was in remand custody over allegations of aiding and abetting the murder of underworld figure Ganemulla Sanjeewa, was ordered to be released on bail by Colombo High Court Judge Manjula Thilakaratne today.

title: TPA urges EU to condition GSP+ concessions on tangible democratic, human rights reforms in Sri Lanka
byline: The Tamil Progressive Alliance (TPA) has submitted a comprehensive five-point proposal to the visiting European Union GSP+ Monitoring Delegation urging that any future extension of the GSP+ trade concession to Sri Lanka be strictly conditioned on measurable and time-bound progress in areas of human rights, democratic reform and social justice.

title: CSE declines amid profit-taking pressure
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) concluded today’s trading session on a negative note, with the All Share Price Index (ASPI) closing just below the 15,800 level.

title: Elephant falls on motorcar in road mishap
byline: An elephant fell on a speeding motorcar that collided with it near the 6th kilometre post on the Puttalam–Anuradhapura road.

title: No April 30 deadline for WHT declarations: IRD Commissioner says
byline: The Commissioner General of the Inland Revenue Department (IRD) today denied a report circulating on social media claiming that April 30 is the last date for individuals subject to withholding tax (WHT) on interest income, but without taxable income, to submit their self-declaration to banks and financial institutions.

title: Vedda chief introduces new political culture
byline: A new political culture in election propaganda campaigns was introduced yesterday by Vedda Chief Wanaspathi Uruwarige Vannila Ettho.

title: Government agreed to IMF electricity prices revision: Dy. Minister
byline: Claiming that the government has not refuted to adopt cost reflective electricity pricing as proposed by the International Monetary Fund (IMF),Deputy Minister of Finance Dr. Anil Jayantha said yesterday the the government agreed to the IMF to revise electricity prices in June.

title: LIOC, Sinopec follow CPC in fuel price revision
byline: In line with the fuel price revision by the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC), Lanka Indian Oil Corporation (LIOC) and Sinopec Energy Lanka (Private) Limited have decided to reduce fuel prices, effective from tonight.

title: 8-year-old detained overnight by police in place of absentee mother
byline: The Officer-in-Charge (OIC) of the Welioya Police Station has been ordered to personally appear before the Circuit Magistrate Court in Padaviya and report on allegations that an 8-year-old schoolboy was taken into custody and detained overnight at the police station because his mother, who was the subject of an arrest warrant, was not present at the time.

title: Card system soon for SLTB and private transport to curb fraud: Deputy Minister
byline: Since cash transactions often lead to fraud and corruption, a card payment system will be introduced as soon as possible for the Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) and the private transport sector, Transport and Highways Deputy Minister Prasanna Gunasena said.

title: No price revision for LAUGFS gas
byline: There will be no price revision for LAUGFS Gas domestic cylinder refills in May, LAUGFS Gas Director and Cluster CEO Dr. Niroshan J. Pieries said.
